alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Muskogee; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 23 at 9:17PM CDT until September 23 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MCINTOSH...OKMULGEE...WESTERN MUSKOGEE AND EAST CENTRAL OKFUSKEE COUNTIES... At 917 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Morris to 2 miles northeast of Dewar to 2 miles west of Okmulgee State Park, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Henryetta... Morris... Dewar... Schulter... Grayson... Council Hill... Hoffman... Preston... Okmulgee State Park... Hitchita... Pierce... Eram... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 232 and 262. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
